definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: Joke and tall tale tellers play with language.
sentences.chinese: 高大的笑话和故事监票发挥语言。

sentences.english: The plenary assembly official election supposes scrutineer 36.
sentences.chinese: 大会全体会议正式选举设监票人36名。

sentences.english: The conference first adopted the congress to elect the scrutineer and the total scrutineer name list.
sentences.chinese: 会议首先通过了大会选举监票人和总监票人名单。

sentences.english: The conference first adopted the congress to elect the scrutineer and the total scrutineer name list.
sentences.chinese: 会议首先通过了大会选举监票人和总监票人名单。

definition: to read ballot slips out loud
competitive election (i.e. with more candidates than seats)
non-competitive election (i.e. with as many candidates as there are seats)/single-candidate election
(of a document) not bearing a name/unregistered (financial securities etc)/bearer (bond)/secret (ballot etc)/anonymous/unattributed (remarks)/(of a check) payable to the bearer
